segment.target: We are currently traveling in **Close Space**.
We are now traveling through **Deep space**.
We are now traveling through **Infinite space**.
There is no fuel in the *Combustion Chamber*! The infra-luminal travel is impossible.
The *Emergency Reactor* is down! The infra-luminal travel is impossible.
Share this planet with the crew.
**Chun** is present. This means that special types of research are possible.
An **infected crewmember** is dead and is now serving as a sample.
You're lost on this planet. Your morale will quickly decline... Beg the crew to come and get you.
Here you can read the report on your expedition.
You are accessing NERON's BIOS. Only the administrator can modify its settings.

Controls the allocation of CPU timeslots. This either makes research or NERON projects easier to progress, increases the amount of GeoData provided by planetary analysis, or puts the CPU in 'CBA' Mode (lazy) where it doesn't do much at all. This attribute can only be changed **once per day per person** to ensure no cognitive overload is sustained by NERON.

:point: Piloting lock: Non-pilots are not authorized to pilot a Patrol Craft/Icarus.//:point: Projects lock: Non-designers are not authorized to participate in project development.//:point: Research lock: non-biologists and non-medics are not allowed to take part in scientific research.
Activates the magnetic net which allows the crew to leave the Patrol Craft to their doom. Or otherwise...
Activates NERON's behavior inhibitor. The inhibitor changes a number of NERON's aggressive behaviors.

Getting PILGRED back online requires considerable skills. You must be fully stocked with patience and survive awhile to get the job done. Once it has been repaired, the possibility of returning to Sol will be open to you. What will you do then?
Share the advancement of the PILGRED repairs with the crew.
There are no more projects to be completed.
Share these projects with the crew.
There are no more projects to be completed.
Share these projects with the crew.
This module lets you carry out scientific calculations of greater/lesser value. However, science sometimes holds glorious surprises...
The cristalite contains polar coordinates corresponding to the centre on the Magellan nebula... However, to get us out of here, we'll need a hell of a propulsion system...
Nothing to compute at the moment. // Please deposit material in the shelf.
The calculation of the coordinates of Eden has been successfully completed. The coordinates have been forwarded to NERON. Consult your ***Commander*** for more information.
Another ship is threatening us, and it's impossible to trade!
